title: Montage of a Dream Deferred
description: Lying in the gutter in front of a Lenox Avenue ginmill, Harlem of the fishtail Dacillac and Sugar Hill duplex set, Harlem of the cold-water walk-up, Harlem of the Policy and Numbers Kings and the Holy Shouters, Harlem of the night funerals and the charity ladies, and Harlem of the leaky roofs and women in dark doorways, Harlem of race riots and Afro-Cuban rhythms, and be-bop bands at Minton's Playhouse and the Savoy.Here is popular poetry in the best since of the word brought to us by Langston Hughes-America's most famous black poet.
author: Langston Hughes
